Worm Hatching: Special Techs Are Possible!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Monster Types: Beaclon/Worm: Worm Hatching: Special Techs Are Possible!
By Kurasu Soratobu on Friday, January 18, 2002 - 02:12 am:

I happened to make a Worm/Golem that I decided to try and hatch, just to play around with and see what I could come up with. I discovered something _very_ impressive about worm-hatching: you _can_ hatch out Special moves! A Hare/Worm that my worm hatched into had Bang, and the worm itself never moved over E-Class, and so didn't have any Special moves of its own. I am quite pleased with these happenings, obviously. :) Can't help but wonder if you can raise a worm to B-class, get its specials from there, and see if those transform as well.

Oh, and whether it keeps worms from hatching into Beaclons or not, I can prove that 'Spoil' warnings don't keep a worm from hatching into something other than a Beaclon. This worm was spoiled for a good, long time (raised in the Machine Style), complete with Colt-warnings, and it certainly hatched.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Sunday, January 20, 2002 - 07:33 am:

Two updates with worm hatching.

1) A worm raised too high _won't_ hatch. At least, not the one that I just finished raising. No stress, no tiredness, and yet it still didn't hatch, and it was an A-class worm. Not sure where the breaking point is, but I expect that it's C-class (before you can get specials)

2) For the purpose of combining, the creature that hatches is still whatever it was _before_ it hatched. My Worm/Golem that hatched into a Naga/Worm, for instance, still 'corrects' exactly the same as a Worm/Golem.
